metadata.Title: CVE-2018-10858 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
A heap-buffer overflow was found in the way samba clients processed extralong filename in a directory listing. A malicious samba server could usethis flaw to cause arbitrary code execution on a samba client. Sambaversions before 4.6.16, 4.7.9 and 4.8.4 are vulnerable.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10858` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.15
libnss-winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.15
libpam-winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.15
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.15
libsmbclient - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.15
libwbclient0 - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.15
python-samba - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.15
registry-tools - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.15
samba - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.15
samba-common - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.15
samba-common-bin - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.15
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.15
samba-libs - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.15
samba-testsuite - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.15
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.15
smbclient - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.15
winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.15
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.15').
